intro: Stelis campos-portoi, commonly known as the Campos-Portoi orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Brazil. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in tropical rainforests. The plant has pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients, and its leaves are strap-like and革质 (leathery). It produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with a yellowish throat. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
